metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7000 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 10.3.2 isaffected. macOS before 10.12.5 is affected. The issue involves the "SQLite"component. It allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause adenial of service (memory corruption and application crash) via a craftedweb site.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7000` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-browser-l10n - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-chromedriver - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
No subscription required

lemon - 3.22.0-1
libsqlite3-0 - 3.22.0-1
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.22.0-1
sqlite3 - 3.22.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378').
sqlite3 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.22.0-1').
